nodes.bodyText: Declare return type to be Set<String> for extra flexibility.

Making the return type Set<String> does not give any extra flexibility (since this is not an interface). If this were an input parameter, we would certainly want to accept Set or even Collection instead of ImmutableSortedSet.
In Java, it's best to make the return type as specific as possible. In this case, indicating that the return value is both immutable and sorted is important. See go/java-practices/methods#type_generality.
We spoke and decided to change it to Set in order to avoid Guava from leaking into the method signatures.
Some empty lines would make this a bit more pleasing to the eye. How about a newline just before this line?
